item.title: In the midst of a public health crisis, Senator John...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In the midst of a public health crisis, Senator John Hickenlooper has voted to block stimulus payments to undocumented immigrants. This is particularly cruel given how many immigrants have put their lives at risk for us — including the 1.7 million immigrant medical and health care workers.

Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC

CIRC roundly and whole-heartedly condemns John W. Hickenlooper's shocking anti-immigrant vote yesterday to deprive thousands of Colorado immigrant families the ...help that they desperately need in this pandemic. His vote in the US Senate to uphold a budget amendment to block much needed covid relief for immigrant Coloradans is a slap in the face to the record number of Colorado voters who showed up in November to send a message that they are done with the hateful, anti-immigrant sentiment in Washington DC. Coloradans expect better from their representatives.

See MoreU.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper angered immigration activists and some fellow Colorado Democrats on Thursday when he supported a non-binding budget amendment aimed at prohibiting people who are in the …

denverpost.com

Sen. John Hickenlooper frustrates immigration activists with vote to block some from stimulus checks

U.S. Sen. item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In a moving new video, Justin Simmons, activist and NFL athlete for the Denver Broncos, opens up about the personal reason he supports the Redemption Campaign, the impact of growing up Black in America & why he is using his platform to champion social change. https://bit.ly/3rnNdIU

item.title: Governor Jared Polis must offer the vaccine to people in prison....
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Governor Jared Polis must offer the vaccine to people in prison. Incarcerated people live in crowded settings where social distancing is impossible & conditions ideal for infection. The most dangerous place to be right now is behind bars.

Act now to save lives: acluco.org/Vaccine

https://gazette.com/…/article_a071b1e6-667f-11eb-9ed7-3f9c2…

A federal court ruling requiring Oregon to begin immediate vaccinations of state prisoners could help revive a legal battle to speed vaccine distribution to incarcerated people in Colorado, the American

gazette.com

Effort to speed vaccinations of Colorado inmates could get lift from Oregon ruling, ACLU says

item.title: "If they had money and legal representation, their outcomes...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"If they had money and legal representation, their outcomes would most likely be very different." Colorado Representative Kerry Tipper on the need for an immigrant legal defense fund and the upcoming legislation that she is sponsoring. Immigrants are often forced to face court without legal representation due to financial constraints. https://coloradonewsline.com/…/immigrant-legal-defense-fun…/

State Rep. Kerry Tipper, a Lakewood Democrat, plans to sponsor a bill to help low-income immigrants facing deportation pay for legal defense.

coloradonewsline.com

Immigrant legal defense fund sought by Colorado lawmakers - Colorado Newsline

State Rep. Kerry Tipper, a Lakewood Democrat, plans to sponsor a bill to help low-income immigrants facing deportation pay for legal defense.State Rep. Kerry Tipper, a Lakewood Democrat, plans to sponsor a bill to help low-income immigrants facing deportation pay for legal defense.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Yesterday, a federal court found that refusing to vaccinate...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Yesterday, a federal court found that refusing to vaccinate people in prison at the same time as others in congregate settings was a violation of their constitutional rights. Governor Polis has made the same deadly mistake in Colorado.

We are confident that in light of this ruling, and the Colorado Supreme Court ruling against him, the Governor’s action to remove incarcerated people from the vaccine plan is clearly unlawful.

Contact Governor Polis now and urge him to immediately implement a prison vaccine plan placing all incarcerated people in Phase 1b or Phase 2, just like the vast majority of other states. https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-polis-vaccines
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: To celebrate Black History Month, we honor Fannie Lou Hamer, the...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

To celebrate Black History Month, we honor Fannie Lou Hamer, the co-founder and vice-chair of the Freedom Democratic Party. Born in 1917, Ms. Hamer spent her life as a voting and women’s rights activist and community organizer.

ACLU of Colorado firmly believes that the voting, and having one's vote accurately and fairly counted, is a fundamental right of all Americans. We are committed to uplifting the work started by those like Ms. Hamer who fought for equal opportunity for themselves and others. #BlackHistoryMonth
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

ACLU of Colorado

Tonight at 5 p.m. AFSC and Coloradans For Immigrant Rights are hosting a legislative preview to spotlight how local organizations are pushing for immigrants’ rights at the Colorado legislature this session. Join us to hear which policies we are advocating for and how you can join our efforts!

(Zoom registration required)

item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: ACLU of Colorado is pleased to announce Deborah J. Richardson as...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

ACLU of Colorado is pleased to announce Deborah J. Richardson as its new Executive Director. Starting March 1, she will lead the organization in its mission to protect, defend, and advance the civil rights and civil liberties of all people in Colorado. Ms. Richardson has more than three decades of experience in transformative non-profit executive leadership in global, national, and local organizations working to advance civil and human rights for non-dominant identity groups.... Most recently, Ms. Richardson was the Executive Director of the International Human Trafficking Institute of the National Center for Civil and Human Rights in Atlanta and was formerly its Executive Vice President.

Please save the date for a "Meet the new Executive Director" webinar on March 10. Register in advance here: https://aclu.zoom.us/web…/register/WN_qtl2Z9NITRG6DHHz4g3g3Q

See More
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: On this day in 1973, Roe v. Wade affirmed our constitutional...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

On this day in 1973, Roe v. Wade affirmed our constitutional right to abortion.
We’ll never back down from the fight to uphold it — and we won’t stop there. Our work isn’t done until everyone, no matter where you live or how much money you make, can access the care they need.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Anthony Martinez fit the parameters of Colorado's special...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Anthony Martinez fit the parameters of Colorado's special needs parole, yet he was denied twice without reason. Colorado's special needs parole is a fundamentally broken system and needs to be reformed to save lives.
http://dpo.st/3bXSuCk

At 84 years old, Anthony Martinez’s health was deteriorating quickly. He was nearly deaf, losing his vision, using a wheelchair, suffering renal failure and beginning to show signs of dementia. Col…

denverpost.com

Release of 84-year-old Colorado prisoner highlights push to fix “fundamentally broken” parole option

At 84 years old, Anthony Martinez’s health was deteriorating quickly. He was nearly deaf, losing his vision, using a wheelchair, suffering renal failure and beginning to show signs of dementia. item.title: Your right to free speech does not stop at your yard. The ACLU...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Your right to free speech does not stop at your yard. The ACLU believes that you should be able to post a sign or fly a flag expressing your views on your property. We are investigating complaints that HOAs have objected when residents have displayed pride flags or Black Lives Matter yard signs.

If you believe your HOA or Metro District is infringing on your right of free expression, please contact the ACLU of Colorado.

For more information go to: https://aclu-co.org/hoa-infringement-your-rights-regarding…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Anthony Martínez recibió el perdón por parte del gobernador...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Anthony Martínez recibió el perdón por parte del gobernador de Colorado. La clemencia es compasión y el gobernador deberia de usar su poder para liberar a la gente vulnerable ahora. http://bit.ly/38ZwmFT

Anthony Martínez recibió el perdón por parte del gobernador de Colorado debido a su salud y el cambio que vio en él. Este hombre fue arrestado en 1989 por varios delitos de robo y condenado a cadena perpetua.

"Me cambiaron mi vida": hombre de 84 años queda en libertad tras 30 años de cárcel

item.title: In a personal new video, Alexander Johnson, activist and NFL...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In a personal new video, Alexander Johnson, activist and NFL professional athlete for the Denver Broncos, shares his story as a dad and Black man in America and joins the Redemption Campaign to safely release thousands of people from Colorado prisons by challenging Governor Polis to use his clemency powers.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Martin Luther King, Jr. courageously called out our nation’s...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Martin Luther King, Jr. courageously called out our nation’s deliberate lack of investment in Black communities.

Honoring his legacy is to demand our country make fundamental change.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: “Football is temporary. Being a Black man in America is...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“Football is temporary. Being a Black man in America is permanent.” Activists and professional athletes Justin Simmons, Alexander Johnson and De’Vante Bausby met with Governor Jared Polis and continue to push him to use his clemency power to save lives. Governor, it’s time to end the legacy of mass incarceration in our state.

Team members recently voted to donate more than $250,000 to social justice causes, and a few paired with ACLU

denverpost.com

item.title: Justin Simmons, Alexander Johnson and De’Vante Bausby,...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Justin Simmons, Alexander Johnson and De’Vante Bausby, activists and NFL professional athletes for the Denver Broncos teamed up with ACLU of Colorado urging Governor Jared Polis to use his clemency powers to safely release medically vulnerable people from prison.
